au.edu.anu.omhtk.rng

Class XSRandom

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Random
      • au.edu.anu.omhtk.rng.XSRandom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class XSRandom
extends java.util.Random
    Author Ian Davies Date 8 Dec. 2018 imported from: http://demesos.blogspot.com/2011/09/replacing-java-random-generator.html
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      XSRandom()
      Creates a new pseudo random number generator.
      XSRandom(long seed)
      Creates a new pseudo random number generator, starting with the specified seed, using setSeed(seed);.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      XSRandom clone()
      Returns an XSRandom object with the same state as the original
      long getSeed()
      Returns the current state of the seed, can be used to clone the object
      protected int next(int nbits)
      Implementation of George Marsaglia's elegant Xorshift random generator 30% faster and better quality than the built-in java.util.random see also see http://www.javamex.com/tutorials/random_numbers/xorshift.shtml
      void setSeed(long seed)
      Sets the seed for this pseudo random number generator.

        doubles, doubles, doubles, doubles, ints, ints, ints, ints, longs, longs, longs, longs, nextBoolean, nextBytes, nextDouble, nextFloat, nextGaussian, nextInt, nextInt, nextLong

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • XSRandom

        public XSRandom()
        Creates a new pseudo random number generator. The seed is initialized to the current time, as if by setSeed(System.currentTimeMillis());.

      • XSRandom

        public XSRandom(long seed)
        Creates a new pseudo random number generator, starting with the specified seed, using setSeed(seed);.
        Parameters:
        seed - the initial seed

    • Method Detail

      • getSeed

        public long getSeed()
        Returns the current state of the seed, can be used to clone the object

      • setSeed

        public void setSeed(long seed)
        Sets the seed for this pseudo random number generator. As described above, two instances of the same random class, starting with the same seed, produce the same results, if the same methods are called.
        Overrides:
        setSeed in class java.util.Random
        Parameters:
        s - the new seed

      • clone

        public XSRandom clone()
        Returns an XSRandom object with the same state as the original
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • next

        protected int next(int nbits)
        Implementation of George Marsaglia's elegant Xorshift random generator 30% faster and better quality than the built-in java.util.random see also see http://www.javamex.com/tutorials/random_numbers/xorshift.shtml
        Overrides:
        next in class java.util.Random
